kaleidoscope

Class Polygon

  • java.lang.Object
    • kaleidoscope.Shape
      • kaleidoscope.Polygon

  • public class Polygon
extends Shape
    Polygon extends Shape and adds methods and instance variables that make it compatible with the drawing methods drawPolygon and fillPolygon. Overwrites the Shape method makeFacets(). (Does not use the inherited variable facets, so inherited method getFacets() will not return the Polygon's reflections. Instead use getFacetsPolygon().)
    Author:
    Nicki Hoffman, Ryan Smith

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int[][][] getFacetsPolygon() 
      void makeFacets()
      Computes & stores the x, y coordinates of each of the object's reflections/facets (including the original) in facets; facets[i][0][] = x's for facet i, facets[i][1][] = y's for facet i.

      • Methods inherited from class kaleidoscope.Shape

        flip, getColor, getFacets, getHeight, getWidth, getX, getxDelta, getY, getyDelta, initFacets, makeOneStep, mirror, setColor, setHeight, setLimits, setWidth, setxDelta, setyDelta

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • makeFacets

        public void makeFacets()
        Computes & stores the x, y coordinates of each of the object's reflections/facets (including the original) in facets; facets[i][0][] = x's for facet i, facets[i][1][] = y's for facet i.
        Overrides:
        makeFacets in class Shape

      • getFacetsPolygon

        public int[][][] getFacetsPolygon()
        Returns:
        int[][][] pFacets - an array each of whose elements represents one facet, as the pair of arrays containing the x values and y values for that facet.
